item.title: 禁烟令和 "无烟 "吸管：关于烟草未来的争论
item.description: 随着全球吸烟率的下降，一些国家甚至试图禁止吸烟，烟草公司找到了其他赚钱的方法，满足人们对尼古丁的渴望，尼古丁是烟草中令人上瘾的兴奋剂。无烟 "尼古丁产品的销量正在蚕食香烟和其他可燃物的销量。然而，卫生官员在是否应该纵容这些产品的问题上存在分歧。虽然尼古丁产品的致命性低于香烟，但它们同样容易让使用者上瘾，而且还可能对人体有害。【原文：As rates of smoking decline worldwide, and some countries even try to ban it, tobacco companies have found other ways to make money by satisfying people’s hankering for nicotine, the addictive stimulant found in tobacco. Sales of “smoke-free” nicotine products are eating into those of cigarettes and other combustibles. Yet health officials are divided as to whether they should condone these products. While less deadly than cigarettes, they can hook users just as easily and may also have harmful】

item.title: 由 Citadel 投资的 Prime Brokerage 正在洽谈筹集新资金的事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在数字资产市场反弹的背景下，由 Citadel Securities 支持的一家初创黄金经纪公司成为寻求筹集新资金的最新公司。【原文：A startup prime brokerage backed by Citadel Securities is the latest firm looking to raise new funds amid a bounceback in the digital-asset market, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利通过四部分交易加入银行债券大军
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）在公布第一季度收入超出预期后的第二天就开始出售债券，与摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）和富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.）等竞争对手一样，在公布盈利后进入美国投资级市场。【原文：Morgan Stanley is selling bonds a day after reporting first-quarter revenue that exceeded expectations, joining rivals JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Wells Fargo & Co. in tapping the US investment-grade market after posting earnings.】

item.title: 喜力尼日利亚分公司因外汇成本上涨关闭两家工厂
item.description: 喜力公司（Heineken NV）尼日利亚分公司暂时关闭了在这个西非国家的两家工厂，原因是货币贬值导致成本增加，削弱了消费者的购买力。【原文：Heineken NV’s Nigerian unit temporarily shut two factories in the West African nation, plagued by the depreciation of the currency that increased costs and impaired the purchasing power of consumers.】

item.title: 拜登面临委内瑞拉石油制裁的艰难抉择
item.description:
美国总统必须追究马杜罗的责任，同时在大选年控制国内天然气价格。【原文：

The US president must hold Maduro to account while keeping a lid on domestic gas prices in an election year.

】

item.title: 据说道富将探索收购法国兴业银行的托管部门
item.description: 据知情人士透露，在这家法国银行努力精简业务之际，道富公司正在探索收购法国兴业银行（Societe Generale SA）托管业务的可能性。【原文：State Street Corp. is exploring a potential acquisition of Societe Generale SA’s custody business, people with knowledge of the matter said, as the French lender pushes to streamline its operations.】

item.title: 美国合众银行在存款压力下下调贷款收入预期
item.description: 由于贷方面临为存款支付更多费用的压力，美国合众银行（U.S. Bancorp）下调了本年度利润主要驱动因素的展望。【原文：U.S. Bancorp reduced the outlook for a key driver of its profit for the year as lenders face pressure to pay more for deposits.】

item.title: 对冲基金抛售获胜能源股 买入飙升石油股
item.description: 随着能源股的交易接近历史高点，石油价格也在攀升，对冲基金认为他们已经找到了一个可以利用的交易：卖出股票，将利润用于购买更多原油。【原文：With energy stocks trading near all-time highs and oil climbing as well, hedge funds think they’ve found a trade to capitalize: Sell the shares and pour the profits into buying more crude.】

item.title: 银行家因放弃新工作而被收取数百万分手费
item.description: 银行家们正在将 "分手费 "这一长期以来在企业收购中固定使用的概念应用于一种截然不同的收购目标：彼此。【原文：Bankers are applying the idea of a “breakup fee,” a longtime fixture in corporate takeovers, to a very different kind of acquisition target: each other.】

item.title: 赞比亚铜矿受到国家电力公司停电警告的影响
item.description: 据一个行业协会称，赞比亚国家电力公司已发出通知，对一些矿山的电力供应实施不可抗力，这对正在经历前所未有的挤压的铜市场构成了额外的压力。【原文：Zambia’s state power utility has served notices of force majeure on supply of electricity to some mines, according to an industry association, threatening additional pressure on a copper market going through an unprecedented squeeze.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期抵押贷款利率升至 7.13% 的四个月新高
item.description: 上周，美国抵押贷款利率攀升至四个月来的新高，这可能预示着住宅房地产市场的复苏将更加崎岖。【原文：US mortgage rates climbed to a four-month high last week, potentially signaling a bumpier recovery for the residential real estate market.】

item.title: 除非有储备支持，否则津巴布韦不会印制更多 ZiG 纸币
item.description: 津巴布韦央行行长约翰-穆沙亚万胡说，除非津巴布韦拥有支持新货币的储备金，否则不会增印 ZiG 纸币，因为这可能导致新货币贬值。【原文：Zimbabwe won’t print additional ZiG notes unless it has the reserves to back the new currency, as that could cause it to tank, central bank Governor John Mushayavanhu said.】

item.title: 日元疲软，中国富裕游客拉动日本奢侈品需求
item.description: 路威酩轩集团（LVMH）的第一季度财报带来了令人欣慰的迹象：中国的富裕购物者正在为奢侈品挥金如土，只不过不是在中国。【原文：LVMH’s first-quarter results brought reassuring signs that wealthy Chinese shoppers are splashing out on luxury items — just not in China.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。S&P 期货有望反弹，因为交易商期待企业盈利来消除降息时间不确定性带来的影响。与此同时，拜登总统呼吁对中国钢铁和铝征收更高的关税。【原文：Good morning. S&P futures are poised for a rebound as traders look to corporate earnings to take the sting out of uncertainty around the timing of interest rate cuts. Meanwhile, President Biden is calling for higher tariffs on Chinese steel and aluminum.】

item.title: 空中客车公司与罗尔斯-罗伊斯公司接近达成价值 200 亿美元的土耳其航空公司零部件交易
item.description: 土耳其航空公司（Turkish Airlines）将与罗尔斯-罗伊斯控股公司（Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc）和空中客车公司（Airbus SE）签署一项协议，在国内生产价值高达 200 亿美元的飞机零部件，这是该公司去年宣布的巨型飞机采购计划的一部分。【原文：Turkish Airlines is set to sign an agreement with Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc and Airbus SE for the domestic production of aircraft components valued at as much as $20 billion, part of its mega plane purchase announced last year.】

item.title: 马德里竞技队获胜后，多特蒙德看到了冠军联赛的曙光
item.description: 多特蒙德对阵马德里竞技队的六球大胜，不仅使德国足球队自 2013 年以来首次进入欧洲冠军联赛半决赛。这也为这家唯一上市的德甲足球俱乐部带来了更多利润。【原文：Borussia Dortmund’s six-goal thriller against Atlético de Madrid didn’t just land the German football team its first place in a UEFA Champions League semi-final since 2013. It also promises more profit for the only listed Bundesliga football club.】

item.title: 沙特尼欧姆公司为价值 15 亿美元的沙漠城市寻求更多资金
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，沙特阿拉伯的 Neom 公司正计划在今年晚些时候首次出售里亚尔债券，为其计划在未来城市实施的价值 1.5 万亿美元的建设项目寻找更多的资金来源。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Neom is planning its debut riyal bond sale for later this year as it looks for more sources of funding for the $1.5 trillion worth of construction projects it’s planned for the futuristic city, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 伦敦被忽视的外城区助推房租创纪录上涨
item.description: 伦敦长期被忽视的外围行政区助推了首都租金通胀率达到历史最高水平，加剧了租户的生活成本危机。【原文：London’s long-overlooked outer boroughs helped to drive the pace of rental inflation in the capital to its highest level on record, compounding a cost-of-living crisis for tenants.】

item.title: 财政委员会称马克龙的预算计划缺乏可信度
item.description: 法国财政监督机构表示，法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）提出的到2027年将预算赤字控制在经济产出3%以下的计划缺乏可信度，需要付出前所未有的努力来控制支出。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron’s plan to get the budget deficit under 3% of economic output by 2027 lacks credibility and would require unprecedented efforts to curb spending, the country’s fiscal watchdog said.】

item.title: 瑞士议会拒绝加入制裁俄罗斯工作组
item.description: 瑞士议会拒绝了要求瑞士政府加入美国领导的对俄制裁工作组的提议，称作为独立方与该机构合作就足够了。【原文：Switzerland’s parliament rejected a proposal for the government to join a US-led sanctions task force against Russia, saying cooperation with the body as an independent party is sufficient.】

item.title: 保费不断上涨，保险公司称诉讼是罪魁祸首
item.description:
"社会膨胀 "是他们用来描述他们所认为的对法律制度的滥用。倡导者说，几乎没有证据表明两者之间存在联系。【原文：

“Social inflation” is the term they use to describe what they see as abuse of the legal system. Advocates say there’s little evidence of a connection.

】

item.title: 德意志银行 DWS 发现房地产存在新风险
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的资产管理部门表示，欧洲的房地产投资者在相关估值方面面临着新的风险。【原文：Real estate investors in Europe face a new risk to underlying valuations, the asset management unit of Deutsche Bank AG says.】

item.title: 美元巩固涨势，新兴市场跌势暂缓
item.description: 随着美元和国债收益率巩固涨势，新兴市场资产趋于稳定，减轻了对风险较高市场的压力。【原文：Emerging-market assets steadied as the US dollar and Treasury yields have consolidated gains, reducing pressure on riskier markets.】

item.title: 樱花和廉价日元刺激访日游客人数创新高
item.description: 由于樱花季提前到来以及日元疲软，日本 3 月份接待的游客人数创下历史新高。【原文：Japan hosted a record number of tourists in March as the country’s early start to cherry blossom season and a weakening yen drew in holidaymakers.】

item.title: 米其林质疑欧盟寻找轮胎卡特尔证据
item.description: 米其林正在质疑欧盟反垄断机构对其设施进行突击检查的合法性，因为监管机构在整个轮胎行业寻找涉嫌操纵价格卡特尔的证据。【原文：Michelin is challenging the legality of European Union antitrust raids on its facilities as regulators swept across the tire industry for evidence of a suspected price-fixing cartel.】

item.title: 西班牙公用事业公司 Naturgy 的股票在收购报道中停牌
item.description: 在媒体连续两天报道阿布扎比投资者可能竞购西班牙天然气和电力公司 Naturgy Energy Group 之后，该公司暂停交易。【原文：Trading of Naturgy Energy Group, a Spanish gas and power firm, was suspended following two days of media reports on a potential bid by an Abu Dhabi-based investor.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，东芝将裁员 5000 人，这是东芝重组的最新举措
item.description: 日经新闻》（Nikkei）周三称，东芝公司计划在日本裁员 5000 人，约占其国内员工总数的十分之一，以削减成本并专注于基础设施和数字技术业务。【原文：Toshiba Corp. plans to cut 5,000 jobs in Japan, or roughly a tenth of its domestic headcount, in a bid to cut costs and focus on its infrastructure and digital technology operations, the Nikkei said Wednesday.】

item.title: 马航寻求减轻中东航线飞机负荷
item.description: 伊朗上周末对以色列的袭击迫使航空公司不得不绕道而行，马来西亚航空公司将暂时停止在吉隆坡飞往伦敦的客机上运送货物。【原文：Malaysia Airlines will temporarily stop carrying cargo on its passenger flights from Kuala Lumpur to London after Iran’s attack on Israel over the weekend forced airlines to make lengthy detours.】

item.title: 阿什莫尔逆流而上，大举押注中国而非印度
item.description: 总部位于伦敦的资产管理公司阿什莫尔集团（Ashmore Group PLC）正在减少对印度股票的投资，并将中国列为其新兴市场基金的首选，理由是印度股市被过度炒作且过于拥挤，而中国股市将迎来反弹。【原文：London-based asset manager Ashmore Group PLC is reducing its exposure to Indian equities and has made China the #1 pick in its emerging-markets fund, arguing that India’s stock market is overhyped and overcrowded while China’s is set for a rebound.】

item.title: 南非通胀缓解，不太可能触发降息
item.description: 南非 3 月份的通胀率降至两个月来的最低点，但这不太可能说服决策者削减借贷成本，因为由于油价上涨和兰特再度疲软，预计通胀率的下降将是短暂的。【原文：South Africa’s inflation rate dipped to a two-month low in March, but that is unlikely to persuade policymakers to cut borrowing costs as the drop is expected to be short-lived because of rising oil prices and renewed rand weakness.】
